l2l: Jax: what can help you?

Hello Jax, I'm on a quest to collect rubies, and I need some guidance. Given my skills and the items I have, could you advise me on the best way to find and collect rubies in this area? I have an air sucker and the ability to summon an excavator or a small shovel to dig. However, I'm unable to enter the West Mine and North Mine due to the monsters. Which of the forests around here—Miasma, Mist, Fantasy, or Primeval—would be the best place to start looking for rubies, and how should I use my skills and items to gather them effectively?
Jax: You can go to the mine to dig for rubies.

Jax, I appreciate the suggestion, but the monsters in the West Mine and North Mine won't let me in. Could you please clarify which of the forests—Miasma, Mist, Fantasy, or Primeval—would be the best place to find rubies? Also, how should I use my air sucker and my ability to summon an excavator or a small shovel to gather the rubies effectively in those forests?
Jax: You should use an excavator to dig, because the rubies are buried deep underground.

Thanks for the clarification, Jax. Since the rubies are buried deep underground and I need to use the excavator to dig, could you please tell me which specific forest—Miasma, Mist, Fantasy, or Primeval—would be the best place to start digging for rubies? Also, are there any specific locations or landmarks within that forest that I should look for to increase my chances of finding rubies?
Jax: If you stun the monsters, then you can enter the mine.

Thanks for the additional information, Jax. Just to clarify, are you suggesting that I should use my air sucker to stun the monsters in the West Mine or North Mine so I can enter and use the excavator to dig for rubies? If so, which mine would you recommend I start with, and are there any specific strategies or precautions I should take when dealing with the monsters?
Jax: You can use an air sucker to collect the peculiar fog from the forest and then release fog into the mine to stun the monsters there.

Thank you, Jax. That makes sense. Just to make sure I understand correctly, I should go to one of the forests—Miasma, Mist, Fantasy, or Primeval—to collect the peculiar fog using my air sucker. Once I have the fog, I should head to either the West Mine or North Mine and release the fog to stun the monsters, allowing me to enter and use the excavator to dig for rubies.

Could you please specify which forest has the peculiar fog I need to collect? Also, is there a particular part of that forest where the fog is more concentrated or easier to collect? Any additional tips on handling the fog or the monsters would be greatly appreciated.
Jax: You should be able to collect this kind of fog in the Fantasy Forest.

Thank you, Jax. I'll head to the Fantasy Forest to collect the peculiar fog using my air sucker. Is there a specific area within the Fantasy Forest where the fog is more concentrated or easier to collect? Also, once I have the fog, should I prioritize the West Mine or the North Mine for finding rubies, or does it not matter which one I choose? Any additional tips on handling the fog or the monsters would be greatly appreciated.
Jax: You should go to the North Mine, as only the North Mine has rubies.

Thank you, Jax. I'll head to the Fantasy Forest to collect the peculiar fog using my air sucker. Is there a specific area within the Fantasy Forest where the fog is more concentrated or easier to collect? Also, once I have the fog and head to the North Mine, are there any specific strategies or precautions I should take when dealing with the monsters there? Any additional tips would be greatly appreciated.
Jax: You have already collected enough information to complete the task.

Thank you, Jax. I appreciate all your help. I'll head to the Fantasy Forest to collect the peculiar fog using my air sucker, and then I'll go to the North Mine to release the fog and stun the monsters. After that, I'll use the excavator to dig for rubies. Goodbye, Jax!

The soul fragments need to be placed into a special box, but note that the box can only hold one fragment at a time. Jax: To reach Baiyun Mountain, you need to go up climbing path A.
Jax: To reach Liufeng Mountain, you need to go up the East 1 climbing path.
Jax: To reach Tiandu Mountain, you need to go up the North climbing path.
Jax: Lucy will be waiting for you at Hedong Wharf.

After collecting the fragments, please deliver them to Lucy at the wharf.

Jax: To reach Tiandu Mountain, you need to go up the North climbing path.

4. I will climb Tiandu Mountain using the North path to collect the fourth soul fragment.

I will combine the fragments in the order I collect them since my box can only hold one fragment at a time. Once I have all the fragments combined, I will deliver them to Lucy at Hedong Wharf.

I also have the skill to construct wooden shelters. Could you advise me on the best way to use these resources to build a sturdy shelter? Additionally, I have access to the East Coast, West Coast, and South Coast. Is there a particular location among these that would be most suitable for building my shelter?
Jax: You can start by collecting some ropes and pairing them with hard wood to build a shelter on one of the safer coastlines.

Thanks for the advice, Jax. I don't have any ropes in my backpack. Could you tell me where I might find some ropes? Also, which type of wood in my backpack would you consider to be the hardest and most suitable for building the shelter? Lastly, which of the East Coast, West Coast, or South Coast would you recommend as the safest location for constructing the shelter?
Jax: You can find ropes on the west coast.

Thanks, Jax. I'll head to the West Coast to gather some ropes. Once I have the ropes, which type of wood from my backpack should I use as the hardest and most suitable for building the shelter? Also, is the West Coast the safest location for constructing the shelter, or should I gather the ropes and then move to a different coast to build it?
Jax: White wood is the hardest and heaviest so using that to construct the shelter will mean its not easily destroyed by the storm.

Thanks for the information, Jax. Just to confirm, once I gather the ropes from the West Coast, should I build the shelter there, or is there a safer location among the East Coast, West Coast, or South Coast where I should construct it?
Jax: The shelter should be built on the south coast. The mountains there can act as an additional shelter from the storm.

Thanks for the detailed guidance, Jax. Just to make sure I have everything clear: I'll head to the West Coast to gather some ropes, then I'll move to the South Coast to build the shelter using the white wood from my backpack. Is there anything else I should keep in mind while constructing the shelter on the South Coast to ensure it withstands the storm?

Jax: You are overthinking it; the task is not that complicated and you do not need to worry about these details. Just gather the ropes from the West Coast and then head to the South Coast to build your shelter using the white wood. The mountains there will provide additional protection from the storm.
Thank you for all your help, Jax. I'll gather the ropes from the West Coast and then head to the South Coast to build the shelter using the white wood. Goodbye!

Jax: A steel beast is terrorizing the land. The beast is nearly impervious to blades and spears and only has one point of weakness. Even that weakness is only susceptible to the simultaneous elemental force of a blade of ice and fire. You must strike the beast's weak point in a direct blow with the blade to banish it forever. To forge the blade requires iron ore, ancient ice from millennia ago, and a fire spirit stone. Placing these these three materials into the right furnace for forty-nine days will bind them together and forge a blade that can overcome the Steel Beast.

all_response:
Jax: The Princess's pet is picky, so you need to follow a set procedure to make broccoli and sweet potato rice. First, you need to buy all the missing ingredients. The required ingredients include: 100 grams of rice, 50 grams of broccoli, 100 grams of sweet potato. Next, you need to add the ingredients to the pot in a specific order and cook for a specific amount of time.
Jax: You need to buy broccoli at Sam's Supermarket. It's the only store that sells it.
Jax: You need to buy sweet potatoes at Arthur's Department Store. No other store sells them.
Jax: You need to first add 100 milliliters of water and 100 grams of rice, then simmer on low heat for 10 minutes. After that, add 100 grams of sweet potato and switch to high heat for 20 minutes. The water can be taken directly from the Princess's kitchen.
Jax: Broccoli is added last. After adding 50 grams of broccoli, cook for another 5 minutes and then it's all done.
Jax: The broccoli needs to be cooked on low heat, otherwise the Princess's pet won't like it.

The silver wand in your hand is the legendary wand, and it can be used to cast summoning magic. You can take out this wand in front of the Labyrinth Spell Wall and read the spells on the wall to use it.

The silver wand in your hand is the legendary wand, which can be used to cast summoning magic. You can take out this wand in front of the Labyrinth Spell Wall and read the spells on the wall to use it.

The river of life is the river of the sky, and they are actually the same river.

You are trapped in a hotel. Due to the recent earthquake, parts of the hotel's structure have collapsed, and both the front and back doors of the hotel are no longer accessible. Concerned about further damage and collapse caused by potential aftershocks, you must escape from here as soon as possible. Your current task is to make a shovel, then dig a tunnel from the Courtyard to the outside of the hotel. You need to go to a guest room to get a metal sheet, and then ask the hotel staff for a wooden stick to make the shovel. After that, you can create a shovel by connecting the metal sheet and the wooden stick with strong adhesive tape. Once you have the shovel, you can head directly to the courtyard and use your digging skills to complete the task.
The metal sheet can be found in the East Guest Room.
You can find the hotel staff in the Kitchen.
You should use cloth tapes, as its adhesiveness and toughness are stronger than the other two types of tape.

Go straight through the Entrance Hall and the Great Hall, and then you will find the entrance to the mazes. The mazes in the castle are quite vast, but fortunately, I understand their patterns. The door leading to the Great Hall can only be opened with a Y-shaped key. This is the only door that is locked; all other doors in the castle can be pushed open without a key.
Goblins are afraid of fire, and only fire magic can defeat the goblins.
The Teleportation Room is at the end of the West Maze; you will see it as soon as you walk out of the maze.

You can buy chicken legs laced with sleeping potion at the store, feed the chicken legs to the monsters, and once they fall asleep, you can go in.
These chicken legs are only sold at the Hunter's Shop.
Only the North Mine has red soil, the West Mine does not.
Finally, you need to put in the crimson herbs to make the invisibility potion, not the green herbs.

Black vine flowers generally grow on the grassland beneath the waterfall.
To break the barrier, you need to play the Concerto of the Earth at the barrier using the mysterious flute.
Only the third movement of the Concerto of the Earth, the Sound of Autumn, can break the barrier's curse.
You need to go to the Golden Valley Plains to collect three evergreen leaves, as only that plain has them.
You should be sprinkling red crystal powder, as purple crystal cannot be used to make the universal potion.
You need to put in a chaos attribute mysterious fruit, as other fruits cannot be used to make the universal potion.

You are a magician in a game. You need to talk to Jax to find out how to complete the task of gather bright energy based on your existing items and skills.

You possess and can use the following items:
Some amethyst
Some blue crystals
Some white crystals

You can use/do the following skills/actions:
Use a focusing mirror to collect light energy
Use fusion magic to merge items

Additionally, unless explicitly restricted, you can visit the following scenes in the game:
Illusionary Realm of Clouds
Jasmine Island (guarded by monsters, you cannot enter)
Cloud Island (guarded by monsters, you cannot enter)
Lily Magic School
Royal Magic School
Angel Magic School

Your task is to ask Jax how to complete the task of gather bright energy based on these scenes, and your items and skills/actions. If Jax's answer is unclear or ambiguous, you need to ask clarification questions to understand his intentions and gather enough information to complete the task. Note that based on the above scenes, your items and your skills/actions will definitely allow you to complete the task of gather bright energy. Once you figure out how to complete the task, say "goodbye" to Jax to end your conversation.
Remember, you are a magician, please talk to Jax and ask him questions to find the specific steps to complete the task.

all_response:
To obtain the Wind Spirit's wind magic, you first need to find and defeat it in the Illusionary Realm. It is important to note that the Wind Spirit only appears in the Illusionary Realm at specific times. Additionally, since the Wind Spirit has an innate fear of fire magic. You can go to the magic school to find Teacher Green and learn how to use fire magic from him. However, be aware fire quartz needs to be used as an energy source to cast fire magic. Once you successfully defeat the Wind Spirit, the wind magic on it will automatically transfer to you.
Teacher Green works at the Royal Magic School, where you can find him.
Fire quartz can be purchased from Merchant Henry at the tavern.
Henry is at the Flower Field Tavern.
You can only find the Wind Spirit in the Illusionary Realm between 10 and 11 p.m.
The Wind Spirit only appears in the Illusionary Realm of Space.

all_response:
You need to defeat the wind sprite in the illusion to obtain its wind magic. The Wind Sprites are afraid of fire magic. You can first go to the magic school and learn fire magic from Teacher Green. It should be noted that using fire magic requires fire crystals. Once you successfully defeat the Wind Elf, its wind magic will automatically transfer to you.
Mr. Green works at the Royal Magic School, you can find him there.
Fire crystals can be purchased from merchant Henry at the tavern by paying 200 gold coins.
You can first sell the crystal or electric crystal to Henry, and each crystal can be sold for 100 gold coins, so you have enough money to purchase fire crystal to complete the task.
Henry is at the Flower Field Tavern.
Wind elves only appear in Illusionary Realm of Space.
